author: Staff Reporter
text:
Gilli Chandrasekar (second from left), Deputy Collector (Training), at the exhibition organised by the District Employment Office at Yadava College in Madurai.— Photo: R. Ashok

The annual vocational guidance seminar and exhibition by District Employment Office was held at Yadava College on Thursday.

Inaugurating the seminar, Deputy Collector (Training) of Madurai Gilli Chandrasekar asked the college students to make use of the training opportunities provided by the Department of Employment and Training.

Speaking on the job opportunities available abroad, Deputy Director at District Employment Office in Madurai V. Subramanian urged the students to be cautious of job opportunities offered abroad by fraudulent companies. He said that even District Employment Office was providing job opportunities abroad through registered agencies and students could make use of it.

R. Muruga Prabhu, Lead Bank Manager (Madurai), elaborated on loan facilities that could be availed by aspiring entrepreneurs while J. Maharani, Assistant Director of Professional and Executive Employment Office in Madurai, spoke about employment opportunities for women. District Employment Officer K. Thondeeswaran said that study materials for competitive exams were displayed for sale at the event which saw participation of more than 300 students.
title: ‘Be wary of overseas job chances offered by dubious companies’
